- Hydrophone usage.

During this assignment you will learn how to assign your officers to tasks at Kriegsmarine headquarters.

Estimated duration: 5 minutes.

<color=#bbb>This tutorial uses section view to explain various subjects. As such, section view will be allowed for the duration of this tutorial, even if it's currently disabled in the realism settings.</color>

Key: Battle of the Atlantic II Description
English: Allied defence is currently weak in the middle of the Atlantic, since it's out of the aircraft range. U-boat skippers call this area the Black Pit. We have to exploit this weakness as much as possible before Allies improve their defence measures.

Key: Battle of the Atlantic III Description
English: After Black May in 1943, it's now clear that the Allies managed to extend the range of aircraft defences over most of the Atlantic and introduced more advanced weapons. Our U-boat losses increased dramatically and the use of wolfpacks no longer seem to be an effective tactic. But the tide will turn. Our engineers are working on a new wonder weapon, a revolutionary generation of electric u-boats that will let us regain the initiative. U-boats must revert back to lone wolf attacks on the Atlantic to gain us the time needed for that to happen.

High command suspects that many ships flying neutral flags, but supporting Allied war effort, started to cross Atlantic to the south. Some of them are enemy ships using a false flag to disguise themselves, while others are private ships from neutral countries trading with the blockaded ports of the enemy.

For this reason, high command orders u-boat skippers to inspect all neutral ships passing through this area to clarify their status.
We must aid Italian naval forces in the Mediterranean and stop the Allied supply ships headed to Alexandria, which are essential to their war effort in the African Campaign.
Military shipping to the USSR is growing each month. It must be stopped to lead our troops to victory on the eastern front.

Key: Sink Warships on Anchor Long Name

English: The u-boat command has prepared a plan to strike at Scapa Flow. It is one of the most heavily defended and important Royal Navy bases. If one of our u-boats manages to sneak in and sink a recognizable Royal Navy ship, it will be a signal that there is no safe place to hide from our u-boats.

Key: Recover Gold From Sunk Ship Long Name
English: Recovery of gold from a German merchant ship

Key: Recover Gold From Sunk Ship Description
English: TOP SECRET: A German cargo ship was sunk on its way from North Africa to Corsica. The cargo holds on that ship were loaded with gold and valuables. Due to the value of the cargo, military commanders involved in the transport asked the Kriegsmarine to come up with a plan to recover it. Considering that the area is frequently patrolled by allied warships, only a u-boat stands a chance to complete this mission. This task is suitable only for the bravest and most skilled skippers in our u-boat forces.

Key: Retrieve Enigma from Sunk Submarine Long Name
Retrieve Enigma from Sunk Submarine Description
English: U-boat command suspects that one of our u-boats was sunk by the enemy north of Ireland. There are many shallow areas in this region and thus recovery of sensitive equipment from the wreck by the enemy is a real possibility here. We cannot let it happen!

Key: Weather Station Deployment North Labrador Long Name
English: Weather station deployment in North Labrador

Key: Weather Station Deployment North Labrador Description
English:
Since wind over Atlantic usually travels from the west to the east, Allies keep the advantage over us by being able to predict the weather conditions on the sea and plan their operations accordingly.

Headquarters has a plan to change that by setting up a weather station in North America.

Key: Weather Station Deployment Bear Island Long Name
English: Weather station deployment on Bear Island

Key: Weather Station Deployment Bear Island Description
English: The Kriegsmarine as well as the Luftwaffe would find it immensely useful to have more accurate weather data at their disposal to plan upcoming operations. For this reason, we came up with a plan to set up automated weather stations on remote islands. Our meteorologists identified Bear Island as a promising target for such a deployment.

The day after the declaration of war on the USA on 11th December 1941, the extension of U-Boat warfare against America was ordered. Admiral D?nitz declared the operation "Paukenschlag" and sent several submarines to the east coast of America.

Because of the great distance, strategic planning of milk cows positions is necessary.

The small islands of Aruba and Cura?ao, about 27 km north of Venezuela, host one of the world's largest Allied oil refineries.

Since the demand for oil by the Allies is increasing, a disruption of the supply would force them to limit their operations and would become a vital victory for our u-boat forces.

Recognizing this, the Kriegsmarine after consultations with the best u-boat skippers, came up with a plan to strike at the oil industry located on these islands.
Destroy at least 3 oil tanks on land with the deck gun.
Your order is to travel to the designated coordinates and set up a weather station on land.
Free space in the storage for the weather station.
Receive the radio transmission from the weather station.
Find a wreck, send a diver and recover the cargo.
Recover at least {0} units of gold.
Pass through Gibraltar strait and reach La Spezia.
(Optional) Avoid being detected by the enemy.

Norway was attacked by German forces in April 1940.  After several battles, the nation finally fell to Germany in the spring. U-boats began operating from a number of ports as early as April 1940 and continued to do so until early May 1945.

After a successful campaign against allied forces in May-June 1940, the German army took over ports on the west coast of France.

These bases gave the Kriegsmarine a significant advantage in the war in the Atlantic. Reach one of the ports to support your allies in even more effective operation and expansion.

The Battle of the Mediterranean is in full swing and our success in Africa depends on the outcome. Headquarters has decided to create Mediterranean u-boat flotillas, but joining u-boats must get through the heavily guarded Gibraltar strait.
Your orders are to sneak into Scapa Flow and sink the most prominent target that you find.
Enter Scapa Flow using the eastern passage.
Get close to the main anchorage area.
Find an u-boat's wreck, send a diver and recover the Enigma machine.
Free space for a diving suit in the items storage.
Surrender to the closest enemy warship...
OR scuttle your ship near any coast.

Our troopships travelling towards the Africa need protection from enemy forces. They will be escorted by destroyers, but an u-boat's presence will allow for a swifter location of incoming enemies thanks to GHG hydrophones that are much more effective than on the surface vessels. The convoy will depart immediately after you accept this mission, skipper. Make sure that you are also ready to depart before accepting it.
